muscles.name: Obliques
muscles.description:
The obliques are made up of the internal and external obliques. 

The internal oblique sits between the transverse abdominis and the external oblique. The origin is from the iliac crest, and the lower part of the pelvis. The insertion is at the linea alba, pubic crest, and the lower 3-4 ribs.

The internal oblique serves the exact same functions as the external oblique - aiding rotation, flexion and lateral flexion of the spine.

The external oblique is visible at low body fat percentages. The muscle appears as a series of diagonal lines connecting to the six-pack.

The external oblique originates from the 5th – 8th ribs, and insert at several points (linea alba, iliac spine, pubic crest, and the iliac crest).

The functions of the external oblique are to aid in rotation (chopping down a tree), flexion (bending over), and lateral flexion of the spine (bending to the side).

grips.name: None
grips.description: No use of hands in the exercise.

force.name: Hold
force.description: Exercise which resists movement as opposed to inducing.

correct_steps.text: Start from the standing position with an upright posture.
Cross your right leg over the left and raise your right arm over your head.
Lean towards your left and reach with your right arm as far to the left as possible.
Repeat on the opposite side by crossing the left leg over the right.
You can do the same exercise against a wall or by holding onto a pull-up bar.

grips.name: None
grips.description: No use of hands in the exercise.

force.name: Hold
force.description: Exercise which resists movement as opposed to inducing.

correct_steps.text: Start from a seated position with an upright posture.
Cross your right leg over the left and raise your right arm over your head.
Lean towards your left and reach with your right arm as far to the left as possible.
Repeat on the opposite side by crossing the left leg over the right.
You can do the same exercise against a wall or by holding onto a pull-up bar.

grips.name: None
grips.description: No use of hands in the exercise.

force.name: Hold
force.description: Exercise which resists movement as opposed to inducing.

correct_steps.text: Sit on your heels and reach out your arms on the floor while pressing the chest towards the ground.
Bend your spine towards one side and reach over with your arms.
Do the same on the opposite side.
